description.body: Wild Rift is celebrating LoL Esports players and fans, learn more about our participation in this year's League of Legends World Championship.

title: Anti-cheat updates coming to Wild Rift

description.body: Our Anti-cheat system is getting some upgrades in patch 6.1!

title: Everything you need to know about Dual Nova

description.body: Gaze up at the sky and take a peek at the new theme and stars coming to Wild Rift in Patch 6.1!
Our inaugural letter discussing the past year on Wild Rift, and looking forward to 2025.
Join us for an outlook on what more hexciting things to expect and celebrate this year! #HexRift
Immerse yourself in the beautiful world of Calligraphia with us.
Learn about the new rank and other updates arriving during Ranked S10!
Patch 4.1 brings new items to the shop for our beefy friends!
Mike “Rogue Fool” Breese has an update from the Champions team!
A look back at the past two years... with numbers!
Heros by night and high schoolers by day, even with a lot on their plate Star Guardians always manage to sparkle.
Patch 3.3 brings new enchantment options!
The final balance patch of 3.2 is here, and we’re making a few minor buffs across the map and nerfing some of Soraka’s healing power.
We’re adding a new queue and making changes to Ranked overall during Season 6!
Patch 3.2 brings new runes to shake up your loadouts!
Elemental Rift thoughts and findings.
Welcome to Patch 3.2: Time & Tide, arriving on May 12th UTC! Set sail with Maddy from the Wild Rift team and take a peek into the future for our upcoming gameplay updates, champions, and events.
Traverse reality and dreams with the latest Wild Rift-debut skin line, Dreamscapes, and discover how Psychic Detective Senna came to life.
Patch 3.1 brings new fighter itemization options!
In the pursuit of harmony, control, and donuts - here's the story of how Karma, the Enlightened One, blessed the Rift.

Like a leaf on the gentle Ionian breeze, Patch 3.1 lands on March 24th UTC! Join Alan from the Wild Rift dev team for details on the new gameplay updates, champions, and events we’re looking forward to.
In Patch 2.6, we’re rolling out a bunch of updates aimed at making Ranked significantly more rewarding. Join game designer MartianSpider for a deeper dive into the Season Rewards system.
Patch 2.6 brings updated itemization through spell shields and support playstyles.

Matchmaking and Ranked are core parts of Wild Rift, but how do they actually work? Lead game designer Josh Menke is here to pull back the curtains on MMR, “loser queue”, and why Gold and Emerald players sometimes end up in the same game.
Game designer Myles Salholm gives the inside scoop on how and why Guilds are coming to Wild Rift.

The /dev diary’s got a new name, but it’s still packed with sneak peeks and reveals. Join Alan and Catarina from the Wild Rift dev team for some exciting announcements and features headed to Wild Rift in October and November.
Patch 2.4 brings updated itemization to provide more variety among item builds in the dragon lane.

Patch 2.4 is just around the corner and brings some major changes! Say goodbye to Promotion Matches, and hello to bans and more. Join the dev team as they shed light on their reasoning behind these updates to Ranked.

We’ve made plenty of announcements about our tournaments, but haven’t spoken too much about our goals. Join the Head of Wild Rift esports as he reveals his vision and philosophy for the game's competitive ecosystem.
Mirross shares the current development focuses for the team. Read on for updates around matchmaking fairness, lag and ping spikes, win trading, and more things to do in Wild Rift.
Events can take up to a year of planning, design and development. Get a glimpse behind the scenes about how an event in Wild Rift gets made!

title: /dev: Thresh Re-Fleshed and the Viego No-Go

description.body: Much like living in Runeterra right now, developing League comes with its fair share of surprises and challenges. Here are two behind-the-scenes stories about bringing Thresh and Viego to Wild Rift.
Game director Alan “Mirross” Moore is (briefly) saved from Ruination to shed some light on the upcoming Patch 2.4, releasing at the end of July.

title: /dev: Irelia Dances Her Way to Wild Rift

description.body: Irelia hits the Rift soon! Join the game designer behind her original rework for a look at how we adapted the Blade Dancer for Wild Rift.
Join Alan “RiotMirross” Moore for a rundown of the latest patch coming to Wild Rift.
Patch 2.3 brings rune updates to provide more choice and variety in your pre-game setups.
With All Random All Mid now at the end of its first testing phase, we wanted to share some thoughts about the mode so far, and what’s up next.
Rolling out Rammus' high-flyin' update to League PC and Wild Rift took more than a quick copy-paste.
The Wild Pass arrives soon! Join Wild Rift’s revenue lead for a transparent peek into our approach to monetization.
Play your way with Position Preference.
ARAM will soon be in testing! Adnan “Sheiky” Mirza reports live from the Freljord with a quick look at Wild Rift’s game modes.
Evolving the way we balance Wild Rift.
Join Jane “DjangoUnjaned” Chen to see what we’ve got coming in this behemoth of a patch.
Tank players, it’s time to engage. Check out some of the new in-game items heading to the upcoming Patch 2.2.
What’s up with matchmaking and lag spikes? Game Director Alan “Mirross” Moore talks through Wild Rift’s plans for the next few months.
As 2020 (finally) draws to a close, we’re gearing up for a new patch, reflecting on this whirlwind of a year, and looking ahead to all the excitement coming in 2021.
Alex “Wav3Break” Huang goes deep on how we plan on keeping Wild Rift balanced and fresh for years to come.
Join Balance Lead Jonathan “JCM1117” Chao and the team for a peek into how Wild Rift gets balanced.
Take a deep dive into Wild Rift’s ranked system. Let’s talk about single queue, Ranked Marks, and trios!
We’re kicking off the Regional Closed Beta, giving you a detailed look at the ranked system, and serving some hot-off-the-press updates about in-game content, gameplay, and new champions.
Each week, we’ll talk about current trends and concerns in the Wild Rift community. Here’s what you can expect from the team!

Brand new gameplay, a limited Android alpha test for players in Brazil and the Philippines, and a whole lotta montages. Join exec producer Michael “Riot Paladin” Chow and the Wild Rift team for a deep dive /dev diary from home.
Design lead Brian “FeralPony” Feeney gives a quick update on our development progress and explores a few champion changes coming to Wild Rift.
